actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 101-375.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 88.
Mr. Applegate asked unanimous consent to discharge the House Calendar and consider.
Considered by unanimous consent.
On passage Passed without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Approved for reporting without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Burdick without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 482.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-259.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: To redesignate the United States Post Office/Court House located in Salt Lake City, Utah, as the "Frank E. Moss Federal Building".

summary.text: Designates the Federal building at 350 South Main Street, Salt Lake City, Utah, as the Frank E. Moss United States Courthouse.

titles.title: To redesignate the United States Post Office/Court House located in Salt Lake City, Utah, as the "Frank E. Moss Federal Building".
